page.title: 12BED & BREAKFAST IN DUFTON
page.content: A family of four,originally from Lancashire,moved into Bow Hall in January 1984.They love life there, especially meeting all the interesting people who call in their tea-room or stay and have bed & breaskfast _mostly country-loving people who enjoy the peace of the fells.High Cup Nick is an obvious attraction to the area.On average,10,000 people walk the Pennine Way each year.This passes Bow Hall on its way from Edale in Derbyshire to Kirk Yetholm _a distance of 257 miles. Unfortunately, due to the bad summer of 1985 only 3000 hikers have ventured the Way,thus reducing the income at Bow Hall very considerably,and making it necessary for father to go out & earn money by selling seed to farmers. The 2 daughters (aged 16 & 12) go to Appleby Grammar School -whilst mother keeps the home fires burning.
